title: Drawing, "Shelving Unit", ca. 1929–30
medium: Graphite and green color pencil on tracing paper, ruled border in graphite
markings: Stamp in black ink at lower right: DONALD DESKEY/ 145 WEST 57TH STREET/ NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite at lower left: ADJUSTABLE LAMP; inscribed in red color pencil at lower right: P; lower right in graphite: SCALE 1"=1'0"/6133 [circled]; dimensions and instructions in graphite
description: Perspective, plan, and elevation drawing for shelving unit. Three glass, rectangular shelves connected at left and right side by metal supports (?); base below supported by four tubular metal feet. Tubular metal bar behind shelves at top of unit with attached adjustable lamp.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Shelving Unit", ca. 1929–30.
ca. 1929–30. Graphite and green color pencil on tracing paper, ruled border in graphite. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1988-101-860.
